result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean J Whalen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: 2nd/Sub. Drug Off.-Class E/F/G/H/I Fel.], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court costs, victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.  To be paid by 3/18/2022.  DOC is to take up to 25% of prison funds.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.
Successfully complete a parenting class.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Defendant advised that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sean J Whalen

records.addlTxt: Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING commencing 3-18-2016 received and filed. (61 Pages.)

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 678
cf
Associated with Charge #1
received and filed. sab
AMENDED. sab

Defendant Sean J Whalen in court with attorney Gilbert Fielding Urfer.  Defendant Sean J Whalen in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Correction made to the Presentence Report.  
 Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Additional Statements by: Leann K and Ava A.
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 316 days. Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 3/18/2022, DOC is to take up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 3/18/2022, DOC is to take up to 25% of prison funds;; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution is set at zero
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Successfully complete a parenting class
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course
-Work or school
-6 month drivers license suspension consecutive to any other suspension
Defendant advised that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms;; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Defense sentencing Memorandum received and filed. sab

Amended Information filed.  Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of a copy of the Amended Information, waived its reading and entered a plea of not guilty (temporarily) on behalf of the defendant.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  The state in compliance with the victim rights legislation.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

COUNT 1 AS AMENDED:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was sworn and examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  Request for Presentence Investigation Report with Recommendation granted by the Court.  Jury Trial date of  2-22-16 VACATED by the Court.  Defense and State's bail motions denied; BAIL REMAINS THE SAME.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Charge AMENDED to:  DELIVERY OF CONTROLLED SUBSTANCE (SCHEDULE I OR II NARCOTIC) , contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 961.41(1)(a), 939.50(3)(e), 961.48(1)(b), a Class E FELONY

Defendant Sean J Whalen in court with Attorneys Gilbert Fielding Urfer and Daniel Adams.  Defendant Sean J Whalen in custody.  
Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Final pre-trial.  Hearing proceeded.  Defense no longer in a contest posture; plea forms submitted.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND in writing by counsel. sab
State is requesting a new Final Pretrial date to review the defense counteroffer. Case rescheduled for FINAL PRETRIAL on 2/5/2016 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15. All parties agreed on the new date. sab

**MATTER HEARD BY JUDGE DONALD FOR JUDGE WATTS.....
Attorney Gilbert Fielding Urfer in court, defendant Sean J Whalen not in court, in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court addressed bail:  Defense motion to modify bail argued and DENIED.  Bail remains as $10,000.00 cash with same conditions of release as previously ordered.

Case remains calendared for Final Pretrial Conference on 01-21-2016 at 8:30 AM and Jury Trial on 02-22-2016 at 9:00 AM - Br. 15, Judge Watts Court.

Attorney Gilbert Fielding Urfer in court, defendant Sean J Whalen not in court, in custody.  
Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Decision.  Case not called on the record as Branch 15 is in jury trial.  Parties provided written decision and order.  Defense files bail motion.  Branch 02 to address bail motion on behalf of this court.  Case sent forthwith to Branch 02.  Case remains set for Final pretrial on 1-21-16 at 8:30 a.m. and Jury Trial on 2-22-16 at 9:00 a.m.
Bail Motion filed by defense.

Decision and Order, signed and filed.

For the reasons given in the Court's decision, the defense motion is denied.
Decision is rescheduled to 1/11/2016 at 1:30 pm at the Court's request. Parties notified. sab
Case rescheduled at the Court's request to 1/5/2016 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15. sab
Certification of transcript of proceedings of EXCERPT OF MOTION HEARING commencing 11-06-2015 received and filed. (33 Pages.)

Defendant Sean J Whalen in court with attorney Gilbert Fielding Urfer and attorney Dan Adams.  Defendant Sean J Whalen in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Matter in Court on defense to Suppress Statements and Evidence and to Dismiss And/Or Suppress Evidence Based on Spoilation of Evidence. Sworn for the State: Detective Nick tachula. Exhibit #1 received. After hearing testimony and argument, COurt denied Mirana/Goodchild motion for the reasons stated on the record. Sworn for the defense: Officer Allison Cerqua. Exhibit #2 received. Case calendared for Decision on Motion to Suppress in Branch 15.  Decision scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sean J Whalen in court with attorney Gilbert Fielding Urfer.  Defendant Sean J Whalen in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for final pre-trial.  Court grants defense request to withdraw speedy trial demand.  Court vacates jury trial scheduled for 11/2/2015 at 9:00 a.m. Defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  Case remains calendared in Branch 15.  Motion hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.
DEFENDANT SEAN WHALEN'S MOTION TO ADJOURN TRIAL
State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Suppress and Dismiss received and filed. sab
to Suppress Statements and Evidence and to Dismiss And/Or Suppress Evidence Based on Spoilation of Evidence received and filed. sab
Compliance for the subpoena should occur no later than 8/31/2015 by 8:30 a.m. sab
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant Sean J Whalen in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock and attorney Gil Urfer.  Defendant Sean J Whalen in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Parties filed a signed substitution of counsel. Court allows attorney Hailstock to withdraw. Defendant withdraws his current demand for speedy trial. Court grants defense request to adjourn trial date. Case calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL on 10/8/2015 at 8:30 am and JURY TRIAL on 11/2/2015 at 9:00 am in Branch 15. Defense has until 9/4/2015 to file any motions. Pretrial Scheduling Order signed and filed.
and Request to Convert Trial date to pretrial conference received and filed. sab

Attorney Eric M. Hailstock in court and attorney Gil Urfer, defendant Sean J Whalen not in court, in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Court is not in session on todays date. Case rescheduled for FINAL PRETRIAL on 8/5/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
for Substitution of Counsel received and filed. sab

Attorney Eric M. Hailstock in court, defendant Sean J Whalen not in court, in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense withdraws request for bail hearing.
All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15,  in Room 502 of the Safety Building.
Case set for final pretrial on 8-3-2015 at 8:30am.  Jury trial set for 8-10-2015 at 8:30am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 6-29-2015.
Speedy trial demand.

Defendant Sean J Whalen in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Sean J Whalen in custody.  Hanna Kolberg for Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Nick Stachula-West Allis Police Department Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
Court ordered ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.   
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Case recalled at 3:38 pm. Appearances remain the same. 
Commissioner directed the Sheriff's Department to obtain a DNA Sample. Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4)
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued. Discussions of bail placed on the record. Court passed case.

Defendant Sean J Whalen in court with attorney Jamie Cimpl-Weimer on behalf of Eric M. Hailstock.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Bench warrant issued in error.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.
Attorney Eric M. Hailstock in court.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Warrant to be issued.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/8/15 @ 1:30 pm
